intro: Hylodesmum, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically small herbs with alternate, linear to lanceolate leaves. They produce small, yellow or white flowers arranged in racemes, which are often borne on short pedicels. Hylodesmum species are commonly found in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in temperate regions. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
